The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: My speaking definitely got better and it was a good review of a lot of grammar. We also read a bunch of short stories which was fun and interesting and it is cool to read stories by really important famous Spanish-speaking writers actually in Spanish.

Improved and refreshed vocabulary. Speaking every day, reading more stories, and conversing regularly definitely improved speaking skills. The lessons, novels, and movies, were definitely slightly more advanced, improving both readings and listening.
Helped improve my abilities in Spanish.
I learned more about Spanish language and culture.
Of the three Spanish levels I have completed, this was my favorite! I loved it.

Many of the assignments were beneficial to gaining experience in learning the language. However, the class size was rather large for getting any individual attention, as I had other responsibilities that kept me from going to office hours.
I would recommend this course to a student who is looking to improve in all areas of Spanish.
If you have a true desire to learn Spanish, then yes this is a good course.
Great course. I enjoyed it much more than L1 and L2 (although that may just be due to the instructor). Felt like my reading and writing skills improved a lot, speaking somewhat
If the year want to learn Spanish then yes

Yes! Especially with Profesora Reymundi. The course definitely improves writing, listening, and speaking skills. It picks up from L2 and not only does it improve these skills but challenges them and dives into more advanced topics.
Yes-- but only to fulfill the language requirement.
Yes, but be prepared to check several websites and booklets for homework assignments each night.

I would be hesitant to recommend this course to another student unless they had a strong background in previous Spanish courses. The workload is quite high, considering much of it doesn't bring about a lot of results.
